result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Crystal A Uptain

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on November 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Stipulation and Order to Quash Warrant
(emailed MASO)

3:50 PM Defendant Crystal A Uptain not in court.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Crystal A Uptain.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Juech requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear and asks that the bond be forfeited.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue. Cash bond to be forfeited.

10:28 AM Defendant Crystal A Uptain appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Crystal A Uptain.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Gumz makes bond arguments and asks that the cash bond be reduced to #$100 cash or convert to a signature bond.  Atty Burdon objects to the bond modification. 

BY THE COURT:  Cash bond will remain; bond modification request is denied.

Atty Gumz asks for a breakout room.  Court puts parties into a breakout room.

10:36am  BACK ON THE RECORD:
Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive time limits.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:22 PM Defendant Crystal A Uptain appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and has Atty Gumz as her Attorney.  
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Juech requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.  Atty Juech states that the defendant has a warrant from Juneau County.  
Defendant can't post any cash bond; she is on a PO hold at this time.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
